title: Grunn

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A brutally twisted undead gnoll in the eternal service of Ereshkigal, lord of Tartarus. Legend has it that he sold his soul to return his most beloved hunting dog to life. Whether that hound is a member of his current pack, none can say. |

*For a list of all gnolls, see [list of gnolls](/List_of_gnolls "List of gnolls").* *Not to be confused with [Grum](/Grum "Grum").*

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Location](#Location)
- [3 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

**Grunn the Punished** is a [unique](/Unique "Unique") monster that comes with a pack of 2-4 [doom hounds](/Doom_hound "Doom hound"). He has a 1% of spawning with the [Scythe of Curses](/Scythe_of_Curses "Scythe of Curses"), if it hasn't generated already.

Grunn is an alternate version of [Grum](/Grum "Grum"). Only one may spawn in a given game.

## Location

- [The Crypt](/The_Crypt "The Crypt")
- [The Depths](/The_Depths "The Depths"): 2-4
- [Realm of Zot](/Realm_of_Zot "Realm of Zot")

## Tips & Tricks

- The [doom hounds](/Doom_hound "Doom hound") are often the scariest part of the encounter. They spawn *extremely* dangerous monsters for where Grunn can be encountered. The Howl status effect can be resisted by [willpower](/Willpower "Willpower"), though it takes Will+++++ to be fully immune. You can also use a [potion of cancellation](/Potion_of_cancellation "Potion of cancellation") to remove the Howl status.
  - [Doom Howl](/Doom_Howl "Doom Howl") spawns enemies from [Tartarus](/Tartarus "Tartarus") around the player for a short time. Aside from the heavy-hitting [bone dragons](/Bone_dragon "Bone dragon") and [reapers](/Reaper "Reaper"), living players should fear the [torment](/Torment "Torment") of [tormentors](/Tormentor "Tormentor") and [Tzitzimimeh](/Tzitzimimeh "Tzitzimimeh"). The latter, with their irresistible, AC and EV-bypassing [Dispel Undead Range](/Dispel_Undead_Range "Dispel Undead Range"), are even scarier to [undead](/Undead "Undead") characters, whether naturally or under the effect of [Necromutation](/Necromutation "Necromutation"). Finally, [putrid mouths](/Putrid_mouth "Putrid mouth") can breathe debilitating [miasma](/Miasma "Miasma"), leaving you slowed and even more vulnerable to the onslaught (not to mention Grunn himself).
- Mind Grunn himself, who often comes with a highly enchanted heavy polearm of [draining](/Draining_\(brand\) "Draining (brand)"). Still, if alone, he's just an upscaled gnoll with a polearm. Many characters can stay out of his reach, or simply tank the hits.

## History

- Grunn was introduced in [0.29](/0.29 "0.29").

Grunn

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Grunn g 
HP 132-266
HD 16
XP 1704
Speed 10
AC 6
EV 6
Will 100
Attack1 50 (hit: plain)


Resistances rPois+++
rDrown
rMiasma
rN+++
rTorm
Vulnerabilities Holy
Habitat Land
Intelligence Human
Uses Weapons & armour
Starting equipment
Open doors
Holiness Undead
Size Medium
Type gnoll, gnoll
Flags Speaks
Unique
Male
A brutally twisted undead gnoll in the eternal service of Ereshkigal, lord of Tartarus. Legend has it that he sold his soul to return his most beloved hunting dog to life. Whether that hound is a member of his current pack, none can say.

For a list of all gnolls, see list of gnolls. Not to be confused with Grum.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Location
  • 3 Tips & Tricks
  • 4 History

Useful Info

Grunn the Punished is a unique monster that comes with a pack of 2-4 doom hounds. He has a 1% of spawning with the Scythe of Curses, if it hasn't generated already.

Grunn is an alternate version of Grum. Only one may spawn in a given game.

Location

  • The Crypt
  • The Depths: 2-4
  • Realm of Zot

Tips & Tricks

  • The doom hounds are often the scariest part of the encounter. They spawn extremely dangerous monsters for where Grunn can be encountered. The Howl status effect can be resisted by willpower, though it takes Will+++++ to be fully immune. You can also use a potion of cancellation to remove the Howl status.
    • Doom Howl spawns enemies from Tartarus around the player for a short time. Aside from the heavy-hitting bone dragons and reapers, living players should fear the torment of tormentors and Tzitzimimeh. The latter, with their irresistible, AC and EV-bypassing Dispel Undead Range, are even scarier to undead characters, whether naturally or under the effect of Necromutation. Finally, putrid mouths can breathe debilitating miasma, leaving you slowed and even more vulnerable to the onslaught (not to mention Grunn himself).
  • Mind Grunn himself, who often comes with a highly enchanted heavy polearm of draining. Still, if alone, he's just an upscaled gnoll with a polearm. Many characters can stay out of his reach, or simply tank the hits.

History

  • Grunn was introduced in 0.29.

==Useful Info==
'''Grunn the Punished''' is a [[unique]] monster that comes with a pack of 2-4 [[doom hound]]s. He has a 1% of spawning with the [[Scythe of Curses]], if it hasn't generated already.

Grunn is an alternate version of [[Grum]]. Only one may spawn in a given game.

==Location==
*[[The Crypt]]
*[[The Depths]]: 2-4
*[[Realm of Zot]]

==Tips & Tricks==
* The [[doom hound]]s are often the scariest part of the encounter. They spawn ''extremely'' dangerous monsters for where Grunn can be encountered. The Howl status effect can be resisted by [[willpower]], though it takes Will+++++ to be fully immune. You can also use a [[potion of cancellation]] to remove the Howl status.
** [[Doom Howl]] spawns enemies from [[Tartarus]] around the player for a short time.  Aside from the heavy-hitting [[bone dragon]]s and [[reaper]]s, living players should fear the [[torment]] of [[tormentor]]s and [[Tzitzimimeh]]. The latter, with their irresistible, AC and EV-bypassing [[Dispel Undead Range]], are even scarier to [[undead]] characters, whether naturally or under the effect of [[Necromutation]]. Finally, [[putrid mouth]]s can breathe debilitating [[miasma]], leaving you slowed and even more vulnerable to the onslaught (not to mention Grunn himself).
* Mind Grunn himself, who often comes with a highly enchanted heavy polearm of [[draining (brand)|draining]]. Still, if alone, he's just an upscaled gnoll with a polearm. Many characters can stay out of his reach, or simply tank the hits.

==History==
*Grunn was introduced in [[0.29]].
